item.title: Cowboys Upend Bills
item.description: QB Kevin Giles led the Cowboys to a 21 - 10 victory over the visiting Buffalo Bills. Giles threw for two touchdown passes and ran for a third as Dallas improved its record to 3 - 1, while Buffalo fell to 2 - 2.

item.title: Inkweller Injured
item.description: All Pro cornerback Ryan Inkweller of the Detroit Lions left during the second quarter of the Lions/Vikings game with what team officials called a sprained knee. His return is questionable.

item.title: Chargers Route Raiders
item.description: San Diego continued its winning ways with a 38 - 3 victory over the Oakland Raiders. The Chargers ran their division-leading record to 4 - 0, as the Raiders fell to 1 - 3.

item.title: Bears Beat Texans
item.description: Visiting Chicago triumphed over host Houston, 13 - 10 in a game marred by a controversial interference penalty in the last minute. Holding a 10 - 6 lead, Texans' cornerback was flagged for interference in the endzone on a pass play to Bear wide receiver Troy Milton. Bears' running back Gary Vinter scored from the two yard line on the next play to seal the win. With the victory, the Bears and the Texans both move to 2 - 2 for the season.
